Title: Lighttpd: Buffer overflow
Synopsis: Lighttpd is vulnerable to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: Lighttpd is a lightweight HTTP web server.

Description.Text: Mattias Bengtsson and Philip Olausson have discovered a buffer overflow vulnerability in the function fcgi_env_add() in the file mod_fastcgi.c when processing overly long HTTP headers.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request to the vulnerable Lighttpd server, resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with privileges of the user running the web server. Note that mod_fastcgi is disabled in Gentoo's default configuration.

Workaround.Text: Edit the file /etc/lighttpd/lighttpd.conf and comment the following line: "include mod_fastcgi.conf"
